_ngcontent-ng-c3098535048="" class="animated-opacity ng-tns-c3098535048-59"><pre _ngcontent-ng-c3098535048="" class="ng-tns-c3098535048-59"><code _ngcontent-ng-c3098535048="" role="text" data-test-id="code-content" class="code-container formatted ng-tns-c3098535048-59"><span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title">SE3KMedoids</span>:</span> <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title">__init__</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, n_clusters, max_iter=<span class="hljs-number">100</span>, tol=<span class="hljs-number">1e-4</span></span>):</span> self.k = n_clusters self.max_iter = max_iter self.tol = tol self.medoids = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span> <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title">fit</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, dual_quats</span>):</span> <span class="hljs-string">""" Runs K-Medoids clustering on SE(3) data. dual_quats: (N_samples, 8) """</span> N = dual_quats.shape <span class="hljs-comment"># Initialization: K-Means++ style or Random</span> <span class="hljs-comment"># Ideally, seed with Sierpinski Centroids mapped to manifold!</span> indices = torch.randperm(N)[:self.k] self.medoids = dual_quats[indices] <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> i <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">range</span>(self.max_iter): <span class="hljs-comment"># 1. Compute distances to current medoids</span> <span class="hljs-comment"># D matrix: (N_samples, K_medoids)</span> D = dual_quat_geodesic_distance(dual_quats, self.medoids) <span class="hljs-comment"># 2. Assign points to nearest medoid</span> labels = torch.argmin(D, dim=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>) cost = torch.<span class="hljs-built_in">min</span>(D, dim=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>).values.<span class="hljs-built_in">sum</span>() <span class="hljs-comment"># 3. Update Medoids</span> new_medoids_list = max_shift = <span class="hljs-number">0.0</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> k <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">range</span>(self.k): mask = (labels == k) <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">not</span> mask.<span class="hljs-built_in">any</span>(): <span class="hljs-comment"># Re-init empty cluster</span> rand_idx = torch.randint(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, N, (<span class="hljs-number">1</span>,)) new_medoids_list.append(dual_quats[rand_idx]) <span class="hljs-keyword">continue</span> cluster_points = dual_quats[mask] <span class="hljs-comment"># Find point in cluster that minimizes sum of distances to all others in cluster</span> <span class="hljs-comment"># Intra-cluster distances: (Size, Size)</span> intra_D = dual_quat_geodesic_distance(cluster_points, cluster_points) sum_intra_D = torch.<span class="hljs-built_in">sum</span>(intra_D, dim=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>) best_idx = torch.argmin(sum_intra_D) new_medoid = cluster_points[best_idx].unsqueeze(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>) new_medoids_list.append(new_medoid) new_medoids = torch.cat(new_medoids_list, dim=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>) <span class="hljs-comment"># Check convergence (shift in medoid positions)</span> <span class="hljs-comment"># We can check if indices changed, or if physical distance is small</span> shift_dist = torch.<span class="hljs-built_in">sum</span>(dual_quat_geodesic_distance(self.medoids, new_medoids).diagonal()) self.medoids = new_medoids <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> shift_dist &lt; self.tol: <span class="hljs-keyword">break</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> labels, self.medoids </code></pre><!----></div></div></div><!----><!----></code-block><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element><hr data-path-to-node="100"><h2 data-path-to-node="101">6. System Architecture: Aurora-Genesis Integration</h2><p data-path-to-node="102">The Aurora-Genesis system combines these three components into a pipeline for <b data-path-to-node="102" data-index-in-node="78">Time-Aware Semantic Reasoning</b>.</p><h3 data-path-to-node="103">6.1 Data Flow Pipeline</h3><ol start="1" data-path-to-node="104"><li><p data-path-to-node="104,0,0"><b data-path-to-node="104,0,0" data-index-in-node="0">Dual Phasor Encoding</b>: Input entities (e.g., from a Knowledge Graph) and their timestamps are mapped to Dual Complex tensors.</p><ul data-path-to-node="104,0,1"><li><p data-path-to-node="104,0,1,0,0">Entity <span class="math-inline" data-math="e \to z_e = r_e e^{i\theta_e} + \epsilon (\text{rate}_e)" data-index-in-node="7"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">e</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">→</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5806em; margin-left: -0.0278em; margin-right: 0.0714em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.5em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size3 size1 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">e</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.143em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; We generate <span class="math-inline" data-math="M" data-index-in-node="92"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6833em;"></span><span style="margin-right: 0.109em;" class="mord mathnormal">M</span></span></span></span></span> centroids using <code data-path-to-node="104,1,0" data-index-in-node="110">generate_sierpinski_centroids</code>. These points define the "attractors" of the system.</p><ul data-path-to-node="104,1,1"><li><p data-path-to-node="104,1,1,0,0">Entities are initially assigned to the nearest fractal centroid based on their semantic category.</p></li><li><p data-path-to-node="104,1,1,1,0">This provides a "Addressable Memory" where the address is a path down the fractal tree.</p></li></ul></li><li><p data-path-to-node="104,2,0"><b data-path-to-node="104,2,0" data-index-in-node="0">Manifold Organization</b>: As training progresses (e.g., via Link Prediction loss), the entity embeddings move through the latent space.</p><ul data-path-to-node="104,2,1"><li><p data-path-to-node="104,2,1,0,0">If the embeddings represent 3D poses (Robotics application), they are constrained to the SE(3) manifold via Dual Quaternion normalization.</p></li><li><p data-path-to-node="104,2,1,1,0">Periodically, <code data-path-to-node="104,2,1,1,0" data-index-in-node="14">SE3KMedoids</code> is run to re-cluster the memory. This "Genesis" step consolidates learned trajectories into new, optimized primitives (medoids), effectively "consolidating" the memory.</p></li></ul></li></ol><h3 data-path-to-node="105">6.2 Application: Temporal Knowledge Graph Completion (TKG)</h3><p data-path-to-node="106">In TKG, relations describe interactions over time (e.g., <code data-path-to-node="106" data-index-in-node="57">(US, President, Obama, 2012)</code>). Aurora-Genesis models the relation <code data-path-to-node="106" data-index-in-node="123">President</code> as a <b data-path-to-node="106" data-index-in-node="138">Dual Complex Rotation</b>.</p><ul data-path-to-node="107"><li><p data-path-to-node="107,0,0"><b data-path-to-node="107,0,0" data-index-in-node="0">Prediction</b>: <span class="math-inline" data-math="Tail \approx Head \otimes Relation" data-index-in-node="12"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span style="margin-right: 0.1389em;" class="mord mathnormal">T</span><span class="mord mathnormal">ai</span><span style="margin-right: 0.0197em;" class="mord mathnormal">l</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">≈</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7778em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">He</span><span class="mord mathnormal">a</span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">⊗</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span style="margin-right: 0.0077em;" class="mord mathnormal">R</span><span class="mord mathnormal">e</span><span style="margin-right: 0.0197em;" class="mord mathnormal">l</span><span class="mord mathnormal">a</span><span class="mord mathnormal">t</span><span class="mord mathnormal">i</span><span class="mord mathnormal">o</span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span></span>.</p></li><li><p data-path-to-node="107,1,0"><b data-path-to-node="107,1,0" data-index-in-node="0">Time</b>: Time is modeled as a phase shift in the primal part and a magnitude scaling in the dual part.</p></li><li><p data-path-to-node="107,2,0"><b data-path-to-node="107,2,0" data-index-in-node="0">Score Function</b>: <span class="math-inline" data-math="\|\text{DualComplexDiff}(Tail, Prediction)\|" data-index-in-node="16"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">∥</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">DualComplexDiff</span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span style="margin-right: 0.1389em;" class="mord mathnormal">T</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mord">∥</span></span></span></span></span>.</p></li><li><p data-path-to-node="107,3,0"><span data-path-to-node="107,3,0,0"><b data-path-to-node="107,3,0,0" data-index-in-node="0">Result</b>: The system achieves state-of-the-art performance by explicitly modeling the <i data-path-to-node="107,3,0,0" data-index-in-node="84">derivatives</i> of relationships (how "President" concept changes) using the dual component.</span><span data-path-to-node="107,3,0,1"><span><response-element class="" data-path-to-node="108"><h2 data-path-to-node="109">7. Conclusion</h2><p data-path-to-node="110">The Aurora-Genesis system demonstrates that moving beyond Euclidean vector spaces offers tangible benefits for AI systems dealing with geometry and time. By implementing <b data-path-to-node="110" data-index-in-node="170">Dual Complex</b> arithmetic, we gain automatic tracking of semantic velocity. By using <b data-path-to-node="110" data-index-in-node="253">Sierpinski</b> fractals, we gain deterministic, hierarchical memory initialization. By employing <b data-path-to-node="110" data-index-in-node="346">SE(3) K-Medoids</b>, we ensure our clustering respects the physical reality of rigid body transformations. This report has provided the mathematical derivations and PyTorch implementations necessary to realize this next-generation architecture.</p><hr data-path-to-node="111"><p data-path-to-node="112"><span data-path-to-node="112,0"><b data-path-to-node="112,0" data-index-in-node="0">Citations</b>:.</span><span data-path-to-node="112,1"><span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c1509015928="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c1509015928="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="12"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span></span><sources-carousel-inline ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER" _nghost-ng-c1143186217=""><!----><span _ngcontent-ng-c1143186217="" hide-from-message-actions="" class="button-container hide-from-message-actions ng-star-inserted"> &nbsp;
